channel.title: Splicing?
channel.description: okay so me and my band played a show lastnight and my other friend video taped it. but we cant upload it anywhere because its over 100mb soo i was wondering how to make it into seperate files. thanks

item.title: Splicing?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

lol i had the same problem yesterday, my uncle lent me his video camera with a tape in it that had recordings on it so he asked me to save the recordings to my computer before taping over it… so i did, and i finished that and it was all good then i looked at the recorded file and it was 42.1Gb so thats half of my hard drive gone…

Read full topic

item.title: Splicing?
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

Or just use win-rar and separate the files.

Read full topic

item.title: Splicing?
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:2, topic:80826”]You could also just use Windows Movie Maker and cut it into sections.

Or convert it to a lower quality and edit out any parts not needed.[/quote]
^ Convert it to AVI. (You can also edit the dimensions to make them smaller)

Read full topic

item.title: Splicing?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

You could also just use Windows Movie Maker and cut it into sections.

Or convert it to a lower quality and edit out any parts not needed.

Read full topic
